text: The 1937 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1937 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 3–3–2 mark in the PCC and 3–3–3 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 25 | Gonzaga | Away | 0-0 T | 14,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 2 | Idaho | Home | 13-0 W | 13,500 |- ! scope="row" | October 9 | California | Away | 0-27 L | 40,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 16 | Washington | Home | 7-7 T | 17,500 |- ! scope="row" | October 23 | UCLA | Away | 3-0 W | 20,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 30 | USC | Home | 0-0 T | 8,700 |- ! scope="row" | November 6 | Oregon | P | 6-10 L | 13,362 |- ! scope="row" | November 13 | Stanford | Away | 0-23 L | 15,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 20 | Oregon State | Away | 7-0 W | 12,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1937 in Washington (state)
